summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of Popunder Campaign Module. All 15 automated tests passed. Manual API testing confirmed all CRUD operations and JS delivery endpoint work correctly with strict validation order.
passed_tests: Popunder CRUD: Create campaign with valid settings
Popunder CRUD: Create campaign without target_url fails (422/400)
Popunder CRUD: List campaigns for a project
Popunder CRUD: Get single campaign by ID
Popunder CRUD: Update campaign name, status, settings
JS Delivery: Returns popunder code when domain is in whitelist
JS Delivery: Returns popunder code for wildcard subdomain
JS Delivery: Returns noop when domain is NOT in whitelist
JS Delivery: Returns noop when project is paused
JS Delivery: Returns noop when campaign is paused
JS Delivery: Returns noop for nonexistent project
JS Delivery: Returns noop for nonexistent campaign
JS Delivery: Returns noop when file doesn't end with .js
JS Delivery: Returns noop when project has empty whitelist
critical_code_review_comments: JS delivery endpoint correctly follows strict validation order: resolve project -> check project status -> enforce whitelist -> resolve campaign -> check campaign status
All endpoints return 200 OK with noop JS content for denied requests (security by obscurity pattern implemented correctly)
PopunderCampaign model correctly includes: id, project_id, name, slug, status, settings (JSON), created_at, updated_at
Settings validation for target_url requirement is properly enforced on create and update
seed_data_creation: Test data is created and cleaned up by pytest fixtures
context_for_next_testing_agent: Popunder Campaign module fully tested. CRUD operations work. JS delivery endpoint properly enforces: 1) project existence, 2) project status, 3) whitelist matching, 4) campaign existence, 5) campaign status. All checks return 200 OK with noop JS on failure. Test credentials: admin@jshost.com / Admin@123
